intro: Picridium tingitanum, commonly known as the Canary Islands spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
